meanings.definition: A type of durable, tightly woven fabric often used for making suits and coats.
meanings.sent1: The tailor used gabardine to make a sturdy suit for the businessman.
meanings.sent2: Her new coat was made of gabardine, keeping her warm in the cold weather.
meanings.sent3: The gabardine fabric decided to take a break from being made into clothes and went on a vacation.
meanings.sent4: The strength of gabardine was like a shield against the harsh winds of winter.
meanings.sent5: The gabardine material was as tough as a superhero's cape, ready for any challenge.

meanings.definition: A garment made from gabardine fabric.
meanings.sent1: He wore a gabardine to the party, looking sharp and elegant.
meanings.sent2: The gabardine sheath dress was perfect for the formal event.
meanings.sent3: The gabardine outfit decided to dance on its own when no one was looking.
meanings.sent4: Her gabardine coat was a shield of style against the fashion critics.
meanings.sent5: The gabardine garment shimmered in the sunlight, catching everyone's eye.
